content.detailedDescription: I submitted a report and i will send picture now i sent in a report earlier
content.summary: I took photos of storm cloud approaching out in there rivers texas

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting in the backyard of my home in rancho cordova, ca, as i do most nights, looking at the sky. lately, i have been watching the area of sky around the big dipper because i have seen a few  lights in that part of the sky recently, in which, i cannot explain away as a meteor, satellite, airplane, or other man-made aircraft. my girlfriend and i,  a week ago, in the same area of sky, had witnessed a blue flash of light (happening multiple times) but not continuous, just every now and again, sometimes blinking twice and then nothing for awhile. this occurred a couple of nights in a row. we named it "blinky light." then, early this morning (july 1st, 2012)  at approximately 1 am, as i'm sitting in my backyard watching the sky, i began tracking a satellite coming from the west. i watch it for a moment until the light reflecting off of it begins to dim and i cannot see it very well anymore. then, i decided to fix my eyes north toward the big dipper and just then what i saw was an object ascending at incredible speed out into space. at first i thought it might be a meteor, but i don't believe meteors fall up into the sky. i immediately new it was something other than a man-made aircraft. it must've been moving thousands of miles per hour cause it had a bright light trail behind it and disappeared in a flash. there were no clouds and it was a perfectly clear night. no obstructions. the high speed object disappeared as it accelerated at speeds ive never seen anything move before. i continued to watch the sky for awhile after that and saw nothing more.
content.summary: A bright light in the distant shooting up into the sky at incredible speed then disappearing out of sight.

content.detailedDescription: Looked in southern sky toward edmonton airport a little after 11 p.M. july 1, 2012. seen 7 tiangular lights in the sky, that were stationary. then several moved acros sky west to east, then all appeared to ascend out of vision.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Seen hovering lights in sky, that moved rapiildy, then dissapeared

content.detailedDescription:
This occurred 2-3 years ago. the date and time are by no means certain. i was in my backyard, after returning from taking my dog on a late walk. i looked up at the stars, as there were no adverse atmospheric conditions, and the view was fantastic. from the south-west, three lights, moving in single file, made their way into my field of vision. their intensity and size was consistent with an airplane at approximately 1000ft agl (i live on the down-wind leg for a small airport, and am a pilot myself). they made no noise, and proceeded to fly more-or less directly overhead. now, an airplane has multiple lights, each a different color. red is on the port wingtip, blue on the right, a white landing light is on the leading edge, and a white strobe is sometimes on the upper portion of the fuselage. the orientation of the lights to the observer (or nearby aircraft) can be used to indicate an aircraft's heading relative to you. however, none of these were present. instead, a white light was emitted from all directions, making the objects look like bright stars. as they passed overhead, and then began to continue away to the north-east, two of them accelerated (i don't remember which two), and began to ascend, one veering off to the north more, the other to the east. the third maintained its' heading and speed, but also ascended, though not as mush as the other two. at that point, all three stopped, forming a v in the sky. it is difficult to say what their altitude was at that point, so i will not muddy the waters with an incorrect altitude. however, after they were in position, their lights dimmed so that they were indistinguishable from the stars above them. fortunately for me, from where i was standing, the light at the bottom of the "v" was right in line with the top of a large, easily-identifiable tree. 
    for over a week, i would check on the lights each night, and each night they were there. on or around the tenth night, they were gone. i tried using binoculars, however i say nothing unusual in that quadrant of the sky during the day.
content.summary: Formation flight, then multi-day hover

content.detailedDescription: Was late afternoon, i was returning from office in senac, it was about 17h30 summer time, nearby my home, i just saw a ascending yellow-orange light in fast speed to sky, it was not followed by anything or anybody with or without plans or other object, nothing was near the object that i saw, the sky was perfectly clear!I know that the object i saw perhaps was nothing for you people, but i know that was an ovni yellow-orange crystal.
content.summary: An ovni yellow-orange crystal.
content.locationName: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro

content.detailedDescription: Wife and i driving north on rt 33 just north of wind gap. saw large silent green fireball. size of a house from about one thousand feet away. caught or eye at about 30 degrees above the horizon from above right. it was heading north west at about two hundred miles an hour and disappeared over the hill we were driving up just about directly in front of us.  never saw any mention in the media
content.summary: Going up hill on rt 33 north. saw green fireball disappearing over hill

content.detailedDescription: A friend and i were traveling home from dinner at approximately 10 p.M., heading south and when we approached a nearby intersection near my neighborhood my friend pointed out ahead from the front windshield and asked what the strange lights were.  before she even said anything i had already observed the 3 lights aligned in a triangle form in the southeastern sky.  at first i thought they were stars since they weren't moving and of a white color, but then they each brightened up a bit individually then dimmed out one at a time.  not too far away from that was another object pulsing red, but moving in the direction where the triangle was, and i observed closely to make sure it wasn't a plane, but after it traveled a short distance, it also vanished in mid air. the pulsing of it was different than a plane also. it was not cloudy in the sky, so it didn't go behind a cloud. we both agreed that we had witnessed something extraordinary that evening.
content.summary: 3 start like objects dimmed out one at a time and another craft pulsing red

content.detailedDescription: I was working out in a oil field i heard of storm hitting san antonio so i got out of our company truck and took a picture of the storm cloud that hit that night the three rivers area i didnt realize i had taken pictures of object in sky until i got home and shared it with my lady. i did not hear any noise or even know i had taken those photos of the objects until i got home. i did contact john schwab here in san antonio today to talk to him on this i did text him the photo he is the san antonio mufon ufo rep for texas
content.summary: Photo taken of storm over san antonio texas

content.detailedDescription:
The object appeared in a blue space of sky between clouds travelling from the east heading west. it went behind wispy clouds and never reappeared. it was travelling very fast. much faster than a jet. i have not seen this type of object before.
about 2-3 seconds later a jet (unknown type) appeared travelling from the north toward the south in the same area.
content.summary: Silvery disc travelling very fast

content.detailedDescription:
I should begin by stating i am ex-military. i know all kinds of aircraft. what they look like, as well as manoeuvres they are capable of. also i have been amateur astronomer for some 15 years.
i was walking my dog around my building, and got around to the back parking lot. there were people about (6-8) on the upper belcony waiting for the canada day fireworks to begin for 10:30pm. when as i was talking to them i noticed a large orange-red ball of light, i thought it was a satelite but it was very large. the object was about the size of an aspirin at arms length, moving from north to south. i assumed it was the same satelite or object i seen aweek before. i told the people on the belcony to look up and checkout the object. i had already noticed it for about a minute or so  before, and didn't say anything until it got over the building enough for then to see it. just as i pointed to the direction to look it slowed almost to a full stop, for about 2-3 seconds brightened up to a yellow-red and quickly accelerated away no noise at all. with it being almost a full moon you could see a circular vortex waves around it, like when a jet goes through the sound barrier. with in 2 seconds it was gone to the south. very cool experience. my friend dennis told me the next day when we were talking about the object, that about 2 hours later he spotted two more very bright objects, but going east to west. these two i did not witness.
content.summary: The object moved like a large satilite orange-red colour, then slowed almost to a stop then excellered away.

content.detailedDescription:
The past few days it was supposed to rain, and it never. thunder showers where forecast in the news and weather channel but they never happen.  
we left to visit family in the morning july 1st 2012 around 11.30am. at the gas station located on the 18th street by the river bridge the clerk informed us that the power went out and the gas pumps were not working.  there fore we had to go somewhere else so we insisted we would go along the way my girlfriend and her sister, on the way to visit family, we cant say who.  on the way back we where driving past portage, and noticed few firework displays along the way home and at about 11:30pm and there was traffic build up and the traffic lights where out. we where on the 18thstreet bridge heading south and on a 90 degree angle i noticed three stars.  theses stars where different, like lights 3 of them in a perfect triangle. looking up they where clear to see.  there was black space and no object in between.  you may ask how, what is different from a star of the stars?  there was no stars and it was cloudy.  i told my girlfriend, and she noticed too. and the lights faded into the clouds and my girlfriend looked at second time and the were gone.  coincidence, around 11:30 am and pm there was a power outage.  i took a picture but the camera wasn't working properly.  so scratch that picture idea.       

1.  i was in a car going home.
2.  i don't know.
3.  stars.
4.  lights similar to fire and fading out into the cloud coverage.
5.  expression word:cool!.Girl friend thought "what the hell?"
6.  the object moved away.
content.summary: We where driving in car, cloud coverage and noticed stars, but it was cloudy how?

content.detailedDescription: Having a cigaret.
content.summary: Please call me for details to much to explain

content.detailedDescription: Working 3rd shift. sitting outside on break. notice a glowing large ball of light that came straight up out of the trees. hoovered in place a few seconds. then the object flattened to a disc shape and shot off straight to the west. traveled must faster than a plane and disappeared.
content.summary: Witnesses ufo lifting out of trees and took off

content.detailedDescription:
I am the asd for missouri and had this sighting myself along with my entire family and some friends (total 17 of us with 10 adults and teenagers included) while we were at a birthday party for my granddaughter.  i was looking at the moon under clear skies when i noticed a object moving through the sky southeast of my position headed northwest.  at first i thought it was a plane, but realized it wasn't after seeing the triangle shape and three very bright white lights pointing downward, and one red light in the center which was flashing sequentially at first. there was no red or green lights where wings should be, no wings, and no tail, and absolutely no sound. if this had been a commercial jet or the b-2 there would have been some type of sound since it was so close to us.  i estimated the distance to be above 500 feet and under a mile due to the size of it.  it would take a golf ball or larger to cover it up at arm's length. there were no flashing white beacon lights, only the red one in the center.  after a minute, the front light on the point of the triangle went out for a few seconds then back on, and the other lights all started flashing randomly, which was completely out of the ordinary for any commercial or military craft. the object continued on its path and out of sight.  i did not have my camera with me at the time. 

a few minutes later, my daughter wanted to take a picture of the porcelain doll i gave my granddaughter- so i held the doll up and as my daughter snapped the picture she saw a bright white orb in front of me through the viewfinder which startled her. a bright white streak showed up on the picture.  we can't find a source or logical explanation for this. no one had a flashlight and this did not appear any any of the other photos. i don't know if this is related or not but am including the photo just in case it is.
content.summary: Large black triangle flew overhead - with changing lights - no sound at all

content.detailedDescription: I was taking a photo of the landscape when 2 ufo appear in the skies.
content.summary: 2 ufo standing over the skies.

content.detailedDescription: I was putting a fan in front of the door to bring in fresh air when i looked up and noticed a pattern of lights. first seen it way off in the distance just above he trees. a triangle pattern of lights pointing up. about the size of a quarter at arms length. my first thought was a bunch of fire flys just above the lawn. looked down to turn on fan in front of the door. realizing bugs dont fly in a pattern that dont make sense... so i walk out the door looked back up and it now much closer but not moving that fast. now its size was about baseball size and definitely a triangle of five lights. with one at the point. the sky was dark blue just before sun up, didnt see anytype of body to it. went right over my house. looking almost straight up (now football size at arm lenght) it was making a slow turn from the east, northeast to the west southwest. the fan in the door was on low so if it made any sound at all the fan on low over powered it. the air did have a feel strange to it, but that may have been the excitement of seen what i saw...
content.summary: First seen way off in the distance just above he trees. a triangle pattern of lights pointing up. looked down to walk out the door looked back up and it went right over my house. it was making a slow turn from the east, northeast to the west south west

content.detailedDescription:
Watched star like object move across the sky at 2313 on 7/1/12
time:2313
date: 7/1/12
witnesses: 2 myself and wife
standing outside, smoking a cigarette
duration: 1 minute
lost object behind tree line
content.summary: Watched star like object move across the sky at 2313 on 7/1/12

content.detailedDescription: Watched a star like object move from the south to the north at 23:39 on 7/1/12
content.summary: Star like object moving from south to north

content.detailedDescription:
On sunday, july 1, 2012 at 7:54pm hst, while working as a security officer, i was on foot-patrol outside when i rounded a corner and noticed a bright star-like object in the western sky. at first i thought it was the planet venus, until i watched it move in a southeasterly direction. this object had no blinking lights; only an orange-like glow. there is a power-plant and some other machinery running at the job-site. normally, i would be able to hear other aircraft, such as helicopters, passing by. this particular object did not make any sound. it was difficult to judge the altitude of the object, and i could not make out any solid surface, as it was already dark. it was a very clear night; hardly any clouds. less than a minute after initially spotting the object, i text-messaged my wife on my mobile phone to look for the object in the western sky. she was driving on the road at the time, with our three children, in the same town. she replied back that she could not see anything. when the object reached the southern sky, i told my wife to now look up and into the southern sky. she replied that she could now see the object. i continued to watch the object travel in a straight path until i could no longer see it in the southeastern sky. i glanced at my watch, and it was 7:58pm.

i then wondered what the object could have been. i thought that it could not have been an airplane or a helicopter, because i would have seen blinking lights or heard the engine running. i thought that it could not have been a weather balloon, because there is no way a weather balloon can travel from the western sky to the southeastern sky in four minutes. i thought that it was most-likely a satellite, but the object seemed too bright and to low of an altitude. it was difficult to judge the altitude of the object, but i would have to say that it was at an altitude where airplanes fly, and not in outer space. i am very curious and would like to know what this object was.
content.summary: Star-like, yellow-orange glowing object in western sky, traveled in straight line to southeastern sky in 4 minutes.

content.detailedDescription:
Okay, i don't know if this was a ufo, but here is a description of what i saw and a few facts to go with it.  at between 2 and 2:15 am, i saw two enormous flashes of distinctively blue lights.  they were low elevation wise, but high enough to where i could see the light reach up over the top of the other apartment buildings.  i am on the third floor of mine.  i was on my balcony at the time.  each pulse of light was approximately 1 second apart and the light seemed circle or sphere like.  both flashes happened in the same exact spot.  there was no sound.  i've also checked the storm radar.  the only activity that is being detected is west of here.  nothing that would produce that kind of lightning to be visible from this far away.  and i double checked.  the direction that i saw these pulses of light were in the northeast direction.  not the west.  it's been suggested to me that it may have been a power transformer exploding, but i would think that a light that seems to be that close by and being that strong, i would have heard some kind of sound.  i have none the less contacted my apartment office to see if they may be alerted of any kind of power transformers exploding in the area.  i will let you know immediately if i find this to be the case.

since i was unable to get this happening in video or photo, i'm including a short sketch to illustrate what it is that i saw.
content.summary: Strong flashes of blue light

content.detailedDescription:
My roommate and i were in the car; i was driving us to fresh 'n easy grocery store, heading northwest on sparks st. in burbank, ca, approaching the olive avenue intersection. 

between the trees, we each saw directly ahead hovering just west of the mountain ridge line four extremely bright bluish-white lights resembling field lights, in a row but hovering and with no supporting structure. no object was visible; just the lights. this mountain ridge line lies between sylmar and santa clarita. the row of lights did not appear to move. we could only see the lights for the briefest of moments, because as we drove through the intersection at olive ave., our view of the mountain was blocked by nearby buildings. it would've been approx. 17 miles from our location in burbank to that spot. if the lights were actually located next to the mountain ridge as they appeared, they would've been roughly over interstate 5 in the new hall pass.

instead of stopping at the grocery store as we'd planned, i continued heading in that same northwest direction on reese pl., then turned east onto clark st., then northwest again on victory blvd. to try to see that exact area again, but by the time we could see the mountain, the lights were gone. this took less than 5 minutes. i circled back to the original siting location on sparks st. to retrace our route, but the lights were gone and nothing else was evident.

there were no other lights, planes, choppers or even stars visible. at 8:30 p.M., it was just sunset, so the sky wasn't dark in the northwest. 

we both were intensely curious, i was excited, i wanted to follow it. now, writing this description, i am baffled and eager to find out if anyone else saw it. on the way back to our apartment after shopping, we discussed whether it had been four lights attached to an object, or four distinct lights in formation. there was no way to tell. i did feel a little creeped out by the discussion of whether it was one something or four somethings, but that passed quickly.
content.summary: Four extremely bright bluish-white lights resembling field lights in a row but hovering and with no supporting structure hovering to the west of a mountain ridge line between sylmar and santa clarita, ca.

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i had been out on our porch directly facing a busy intersection in derry nh. we were having a cigarette when i saw these 3 balls of light just drifting pass. i immediately told her to look. it was flying pretty slowly over the horizon about 1,000 feet away from us would be my best guess and it appeared to be about 500 feet in the air. when i first saw it i could only think to describe it as what a small plane trailing a banner would look like in the dead of night with no lights but 1  burning basketball on the tip of each wing and another 80 feet back where the banner was connected by a line. yet i could not make out any structure or hear any planes. there were about 4 or 5 obvious planes off in the distance at various high altitudes before during and after this sighting. all had blinking lights. the 3 lights we saw did not blink or change pace at all. they stayed simultaneously moving at a constant pace until they disappeared behind a tree across the street and did not become visible again. i did attempt to pull my camera out and video tape the event but i was unable to get a good enough view of the 3 lights. briefly make out one of them in the video. mostly it's just me desperately trying to describe them as they went out of sight. it was shocking, very freaky, and still boggling me. every time i think about it or try and talk about it my eyes almost begin to well up as i get shivers down my back. i have read reports of exactly the same sighting. it's kind of scary if you ask me.
content.summary: My wife and i clearly watched 3 balls of light slowly fly over and disappear behind the tree across from our home

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i had been out on our porch directly facing a busy intersection in derry nh. we were having a cigarette when i saw these 3 balls of light just drifting pass. i immediately told her to look. it was flying pretty slowly over the horizon about 1,000 feet away from us would be my best guess and it appeared to be about 500 feet in the air. when i first saw it i could only think to describe it as what a small plane trailing a banner would look like in the dead of night with no lights but 1  burning basketball on the tip of each wing and another 80 feet back where the banner was connected by a line. yet i could not make out any structure or hear any planes. there were about 4 or 5 obvious planes off in the distance at various high altitudes before during and after this sighting. all had blinking lights. the 3 lights we saw did not blink or change pace at all. they stayed simultaneously moving at a constant pace until they disappeared behind a tree across the street and did not become visible again. i did attempt to pull my camera out and video tape the event but i was unable to get a good enough view of the 3 lights. briefly make out one of them in the video. mostly it's just me desperately trying to describe them as they went out of sight. it was shocking, very freaky, and still boggling me. every time i think about it or try and talk about it my eyes almost begin to well up as i get shivers down my back. i have read reports of exactly the same sighting. it's kind of scary if you ask me.
content.summary: My wife and i clearly watched 3 balls of light slowly fly over and disappear behind the tree across from our home

content.detailedDescription: I went to my girlfriends vehicle between 10:02 to 10:07pm. i noticed a light above the trees, some distance away, that was moving slowly in a south-easterly direction, though the distance may have just made it appear to move slow. it was a bright orange to a redish colored globe or sphere. it was in the north-east above the treeline across the road from my house. it did not pulsate or flash or appear to shift in color. there was no sound that i could hear and i tried to hear if there was any engine noise of any sort. after noting its direction of travel, i ran inside my house to get my video camera, hoping to get some footage of it. my camera was on the table seven-feet from the door in my house, so i lost little time getting it and getting back outside to my driveway. i waited with the camera on, searching the sky in all directions, but i could not see the object anywhere. nor did i hear anything or see other objects like planes and such. i guess it must have changed direction or was traveling faster than i had thought because it did not appear in the area i had hoped it would when i got back outside. we have low clouds and an almost full moon out. no stars were visible in the area i saw the object, only a learing near where the moon itself was to the south of me. i'm still shaking from the excitement of seeing the lighted object (it has only been 40 minutes from the time i saw it until i reported it). i knew of mufon from different tv shows and came inside to see if i could report it somehow and here we are. i'm still happy for the experience, though i have no idea what i saw and wish i could have seen more to help this report. i'm quite certain it was not an airplane or helicopter of any sort.
content.summary: A redish-orange globe. very bright, appeared to move slowly.

content.detailedDescription:
While walking to turkey hill convenience store, noticed an unusual orb of brilliant, orange reddish glow flying directly towards the west. there was firework activity going on in the neighbor hoods but this resembled an aerial flare, countermeasure.  it was quite appareant this was incorrect as it only continued to fly without loss of altitude. abruptly changed direction and ascended until it disappeared.

during my observation approximately 5 to 6 others noticed my attention to the sky and the object and questioned what it was.  various theories were it was a sky lantern or such, but the object was significantly larger and moved quickly and changed direction until ascending out of sight.  the sky was clear, 3/4 moon in full view as well as other small aircraft visible.

this is the second time in a year i have witnessed a similar object same characteristics of flight and rapid ascension.  one other witness was present at the first event.
content.summary: Orange red orb in east west flight path, the changed to south and ascended rapidly and disappeared.

content.detailedDescription:
Sitting on back of boat getting ready for bed near trail creek looking at a nearly full moon when i saw a orange / red pulsating ball of light moving from the sw towards ne on a path that was from my observation to cross directly in front of the moon. i watched as it moved in the direction of the moon and grabbed my cell phone and put it in video mode to record what i was seeing. i have the video however, i cannot see the pulsating ball of light with my pc. i guess if i had some kind of  video editor i could enhance or slow the video but i do not have access to this type of equipment and not sure my iphone video could be enhanced.
it was strange that it looked close and bright but when it moved in front of the moon and passed all the way through the moons path, it was like the light was much further away and was much smaller. it fluttered a few times appeared to have moved to a se direction then completely disappeared.
i have seen something like this years ago and reported it along with about 15 witnesses. the field person from mufon told me it was a orange ball of light (obl) so when i noticed this in the sky i recognized it to be exactly what i had seen before. i watched it for about 30 seconds to be sure it was not a plane or helicopter but no noise or aircraft light pattern was seen or heard.
content.summary: Obl pulsating have seen one before knew exactly what it was.

content.detailedDescription: Objects captured by digital camera while taking photos of storm clouds.  object were not seen while photographing.  one photo attached, with object in the upper middle of photo.
content.summary: Object capture by digital camera while taking photos of storm clouds
